intro: Genista cumingii, commonly known as Cuming's broom, is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It is a member of the Fabaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and small, yellow, pea-like flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in coastal areas. It produces small, pod-like fruits that contain several seeds. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and conservation areas.
